title: Google Pixel 2 OEM unlocking greyed out.
content:
Hello, I have received a Google Pixel 2 a few days ago. I unlocked the developer options, allowed the USB Debugging and also managed to unlocked the OEM unlocking for a short moment. This last part is truly what is bothering me right now.

Fast forward, the very next day, I started the phone once more, plugged it to my computer and when I used adb reboot bootloader, I notice that the phone state is now locked.



Returning to the developer options, I noticed the OEM unlocking suddenly grey. And when trying fastboot commands, the errors that appear are : fastboot oem unlock
...
FAILED (remote: Flashing Unlock is not allowed)
finished. total time: 0.007s

Now my questions are about a few things.
First, how to know if the phone is from Verizon? I saw numerous posts about the tightly locked state of Verizon Pixel 2, but this phone was reformed and I have no visible clues about its past.
Secondly, How the OEM unlocking can suddenly turn grey? I almost doubt myself, but I really, really certain that the first day I unlocked it and only the next day it was not the case anymore.
Finally, if it is not a Verizon phone, is there a way to reverse my situation? I have updated the phone to the lastest Android 10 version, it is connected to Internet, I have used "fastboot oem unlock", "fastboot flashing unlock", "fastboot flashing critical_unlock" in bootloader mode.

My current goal is to have my device unlocked. Thanks for the answers in advance.
